entry.fl: noun plural but singular or plural in construction
entry.et: Middle English cisours, sisoures, from Middle French cisoires, from Vulgar Latin *caesorium (singular) cutting instrument, from Latin caedere to cut

def.dt: :a cutting instrument having two blades whose cutting edges slide past each other
:a gymnastic feat in which the leg movements suggest the opening and closing of scissors
:to cut, cut up, or cut off with scissors or shears scissored the paper into strips
:being a compilation rather than an effort of original and independent investigation
:a wrestling hold in which the legs are locked around the head or body of an opponent
:a swimming kick used especially in sidestrokes in which the legs move like scissors
